intro: Tetrastigma petrophilum, commonly known as the rock grape vine, is a climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Vitaceae family and is characterized by its twining stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically followed by yellow berries. It thrives in rocky and mountainous environments, often growing on cliffs or in shaded forest areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its natural habitat.
